intro: Stenosemia dimorpha, commonly known as the two-form nettlefly, is a species of moth belonging to the family Noctuidae. It is characterized by its distinctive wing patterns, which feature intricate lines and shades of gray and brown. The larvae of this species feed on various plants, including grasses and sedges, making it an important part of the ecosystem's food web. Its life cycle involves a complete metamorphosis, with eggs laid on host plants that provide nourishment for the developing larvae. The plant-associated life stages of Stenosemia dimorpha highlight its ecological role in both herbivory and pollination dynamics.
